articles.author: Joe Miller, Brooke Masters
articles.title: JPMorgan knew about Epstein accusations by 2006, lawsuit claims - Financial Times
articles.description: Newly unredacted filings include testimony from top executive about Wall Street bank’s knowledge of payments
articles.content: JPMorgan Chase was aware by 2006 that Jeffrey Epstein had been accused of paying cash to have underage girls and young women brought to his home seven years before the bank dropped him as a client, l… [+3241 chars]

articles.author: Joshua Franklin
articles.title: JPMorgan orders senior bankers to work 5 days a week in the office - Financial Times
articles.description: New push to bring staff back includes warning of ‘corrective action’ against those who do not comply
articles.content:
JPMorgan Chase is asking its managing directors to be in the office five days a week and warned other employees not to fall short of their in-office attendance expectations.

articles.title: The evolution of non-small cell lung cancer metastases in TRACERx - Nature.com
articles.description: A longitudinal evolutionary analysis of 126 lung cancer patients with metastatic disease reveals the timing of metastatic divergence, modes of dissemination and the genomic events subject to selection during the metastatic transition.
articles.content:
The TRACERx 421 cohort
The TRACERx study (https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01888601) is a prospective observational cohort study that aims to transform our understanding of NSCLC, the design o… [+34506 chars]

articles.author: Jonathan Chadwick
articles.title: Twitter confirms deadline for removing 'legacy' verified check marks - Daily Mail
articles.description: Elon Musk has tweeted: 'Final date for removing legacy Blue checks is 4/20'. It means Twitter users will have to pay if they want to keep their blue tick beyond this date.
articles.content:
If you want to keep your blue tick on Twitter, you'll have to hand over payment details in the next few days, according to Elon Musk.
